title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: goal RiskMap provide set functions visualisation, processing likelihood-based analysis geostatistical data.

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: can install development version RiskMap GitHub :

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . also use GitHub Actions re-render README.Rmd every time push. example workflow can found : https://github.com/r-lib/actions/tree/v1/examples. can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(RiskMap) ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

what: Heavy metal biomonitoring in Galicia — liberia
title: Heavy metal biomonitoring in Galicia — liberia
text: data-set contains counts reported onchocerciasis (riverblindess) cases 91 villages sampled across Liberia.  variables follows: lat latitude sampled villages. long longitude sampled villages. ntest number tested people presence nodules. npos number people tested positive presence nodules. elevation elevation meters sampled village. log_elevation log-transformed elevation meters sampled village.

title: Heavy metal biomonitoring in Galicia — liberia
Heavy metal biomonitoring in Galicia — liberia
text: data frame 90 rows 6 variables

title: Heavy metal biomonitoring in Galicia — liberia
text: Zouré, H. G. M., Noma, M., Tekle, Afework, H., Amazigo, U. V., Diggle, P. J., Giorgi, E., Remme, J. H. F. (2014). Geographic Distribution Onchocerciasis 20 Participating Countries African Programme Onchocerciasis Control: (2) Pre-Control Endemicity Levels Estimated Number Infected.  Parasites & Vectors, 7, 326.

what: Loa loa prevalence data from 197 village surveys — loaloa
title: Loa loa prevalence data from 197 village surveys — loaloa
text: data-set relates study prevalence Loa loa (eyeworm) series surveys undertaken 197 villages west Africa (Cameroon southern Nigeria). variables follows: ROW row id: 1 197. VILLCODE village id. LONGITUDE Longitude degrees. LATITUDE Latitude degrees. NO_EXAM Number people tested. NO_INF Number positive test results. ELEVATION Height sea-level metres. MEAN9901 Mean NDVI values recorded village location, 1999-2001 MAX9901 Maximum NDVI values recorded village location, 1999-2001 MIN9901 Minimum NDVI values recorded village location, 1999-2001 MIN9901 Minimum NDVI values recorded village location, 1999-2001 STDEV9901 standard deviation NDVI values recorded village location, 1999-2001

title: Loa loa prevalence data from 197 village surveys — loaloa
Loa loa prevalence data from 197 village surveys — loaloa
text: data frame 197 rows 11 variables

title: Loa loa prevalence data from 197 village surveys — loaloa
text: Diggle, P.J., Thomson, M.C., Christensen, O.F., Rowlingson, B., Obsomer, V., Gardon, J., Wanji, S., Takougang, ., Enyong, P., Kamgno, J., Remme, H., Boussinesq, M. Molyneux, D.H. (2007). Spatial modelling prediction Loa loa risk: decision making uncertainty. Annals Tropical Medicine Parasitology, 101, 499-509.

title: Empirical variogram — s_variogram
text: Computes empirical variogram using ``bins'' distance provided user.

title: Empirical variogram — s_variogram
code: s_variogram(   data,   variable,   bins = NULL,   n_permutation = 0,   convert_to_utm = TRUE,   scale_to_km = FALSE )

title: Empirical variogram — s_variogram
text: data object class sf containing variable variogram computed coordinates variable character indicating name variable variogram computed. bins vector indicating `bins` used define classes distance used computation variogram. default bins=NULL bins computed seq(0, d_max/2, length=15) d_max maximum distance observed data. n_permutation non-negative integer indicating number permutation used compute 95 level envelope assumption spatial independence. default n_permutation=0, envelope generated.

title: Empirical variogram — s_variogram
text: object class 'variogram' list containing following components dist_class classes distances based provided values bins v variogram values n number pairs observations within bin mid_points middle points classes distance. lower_bound lower values 95 upper_bound upper values 95

title: Empirical variogram — s_variogram
text: Emanuele Giorgi e.giorgi@lancaster.ac.uk Claudio Fronterre c.fronterr@lancaster.ac.uk
